page.title: 14LOCAL NEWS REPORTS
page.content:
JOB SAVED
The Bury Free Press of 19th July 1985 contained a report about the saving of a job at Thurston Primary School,through an individual benefactor. The contract of Mrs.M.Read,empoyed as a music instructress at the above school for 2 hours a week,was due to end in July 1985.To enable the school to keep her,a gift of money was made to the Friends of The School,sufficient to enable them to pay Mrs.Read'sn salary for a period on two years.
UNUSUAL CLUB A club for mothers of twins in Thurston and Norton was started in July 1985,with an initial membership of 8 mothers.
